lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Brennan.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Brennan.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
This feature allows users to add different types of tasks such as Todo, Deadline, and Event to the task list.
This feature enables users to view all the tasks currently stored in the task list.
With this feature, users can mark tasks as completed, indicating that they have been finished.
With this feature, users can unmark tasks which were completed, indicating that they have not been finished.
Users can delete tasks from the task list using this feature.
This feature allows users to search for tasks containing specific keywords.
This feature allows users to gracefully exit the application.
Adds a Todo task to the task list.
A new Todo task "Buy meat" is added to the task list.
Well done, you've added a new task:
Currently you have 6 task(s) in your list!
Adds a Deadline task to the task list.
A new Deadline task "Submit essay" with the deadline "2024-03-17" is added to the task list.
Well done, you've added a new task:
Currently you have 7 task(s) in your list!
Adds an Event task to the task list.
A new Event task "Marriage" from 2p to 5pm
Well done, you've added a new task:
Currently you have 8 task(s) in your list!
Displays all tasks currently stored in the task list.
A list of all tasks currently stored in the task list is displayed.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task as completed based on its index in the task list.
The task at index 2 is marked as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks a previously completed task, setting it back to an incomplete status.
The task at index 2 is marked as incomplete.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task list based on its index.
The task at index 1 is deleted from the task list.
Command received. I've removed this task:
Currently you have 2 tasks in the list below.
Searches for tasks containing a specific keyword.
Tasks containing the keyword "essay" are displayed.
Here are all the tasks that match your search keyword:
Terminates the application and closes the program.
The application terminates and the program closes.
* Duke is a task management application that helps users manage their tasks.
* It allows users to add, delete, mark as done, and list tasks.
* Duke stores tasks in a file and loads them upon startup.
* Constructs a Duke instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Displays welcome message, handles user commands until exit command is received.
* The main method to start the Duke application.
* Creates a new instance of Duke and runs it.
* @param args Command line arguments (not used in this implementation).
* Handles exceptions that occur during Duke application operations.
* It prints appropriate error messages based on the type of exception.
* If the exception is related to array index out of bounds,
* it notifies the user about exceeding the task limit.
* If the exception is related to string index out of bounds,
* it identifies whether the input is incomplete or unclear,
* depending on the operation being performed.
* If the exception is an illegal argument exception,
* it indicates that the command provided is unfamiliar.
* For any other type of exception, it displays a generic unknown error message.
* @param input     The input string where the exception occurred.
public static void handleException(Exception exception, String input) {
System.out.println("You have exceeded the task limit of 100 tasks.");
System.out.println("The task to marked or unmarked is not stated clearly.");
"Your statement is not clear. Please fix this.");
System.out.println("Unfamiliar commands cannot be accepted by the system.");
System.out.println("Unknown error detected. Try to fix this immediately.");
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description.
* If the description contains a deadline date, it is extracted and stored.
* Otherwise, the description is used directly.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Gets the date of the deadline.
* Sets the date of the deadline.
* @param dateOfDeadline The date of the deadline.
* Converts the Deadline task to a string suitable for storage in a file.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task for file storage.
return "D|" + super.toFileString() + "|" + dateOfDeadline; // Prefix with "D" to indicate Deadline
* Represents an event task with starting and ending dates.
* Constructs an Event object with the given description.
* The description format should include "from" and "to" to specify starting and ending dates respectively.
* @param description Description of the event task.
* Gets the starting date of the event.
* @return The starting date of the event.
* Sets the starting date of the event.
* @param startingDate The starting date to be set.
* Gets the ending date of the event.
* @return The ending date of the event.
* Sets the ending date of the event.
* @param endingDate The ending date to be set.
* Converts the Event object to a string suitable for writing to a file.
* @return A string representation of the Event object in file format.
return "E|" + super.toFileString() + "|" + startingDate + "|" + endingDate; // Prefix with "E" to indicate Event
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user commands and executing corresponding actions on the TaskList.
